pgTitle: List of United States mobile virtual network operators

rows.text: {{No}}, "We have the right to slow down the speed of data browsing upon our own discretion at any time during your 5 or 30 day cycle."
{{Yes}}, on Unlimited data plan (only?); 2G speeds: 128 kbps
{{maybe |Yes}}, unlimited int'l calling and texting on appropriate plans
Terms of Services includes "Since you are on an Unlimited Plan, there will be no disputes about calls not connecting or dropped calls or any other reason to call customer service and complain."
{{maybe |Yes}}, Calls to int'l #s on Unlimited plans
Armed Forces Wireless / My AF Mobile
{{maybe |Yes}}, on Unlimited Data plan, though "Usage over 26GB of data in a month period may result in throttled speeds when in congested areas."
Available to the general public. Gives a portion of its proceeds to veterans and first responders via a charity foundation. Previously used the Verizon network.
{{No}}, plans capped at 2 GB max (1 GB max for MN?)
{{Yes}}, on Unlimited Talk, Text & High Speed Data plan
{{maybe |Yes}}, phone hotspot on Sprint only, for extra fee
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling from U.S. with add-on?
Based on FreeMo MVNE. Operates "Phones For The Homeless" program in Seattle and Oakland.
{{maybe |Yes}}, non–Pay As You Go plans include unlimited (but not "unreasonable") calls to up to 10 unique int'l #s per month in 65+ countries
{{No}}, plans capped at 20 GB max on Verizon, 60 GB max on AT&T
{{maybe |Yes}}, but "iPhone Only for Non-HD" (??) on Verizon network
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling and texting, but on AT&T network only
AT&T network available to business customers only.
{{maybe |Yes}}, but only an "extremely limited" set of models, and only non-Sprint, non–Virgin Mobile phones supported
{{maybe |Yes}}, on Unlimited Gigs plan, though with throttling of resolution / bitrates for video, music, and cloud gaming; no Unlimited for phone hotspot
{{maybe |Yes}}, Calls and Texts to int'l #s for additional fees
{{Maybe}}: depends on the MVNO or major network
{{Maybe}}: depends on the MVNO or major network
{{Maybe}}: depends on the MVNO or major network
{{Maybe}}: depends on the MVNO or major network
{{Maybe}}: depends on the MVNO or major network
{{Maybe}}: depends on the MVNO or major network

"Virtual MVNO" that directs customers to WhistleOut (so, arguably "virtual virtual virtual") to get price comparisons of other MVNOs and major carriers with affiliate links to sign up. In addition, users may install and use CellNUVO app to play ad-supported "simple swipe games" to earn credits to apply against cell service bills.
No unlimited services except incoming texts (worldwide). Sells and rents int'l phones & hotspot devices. Offers VPN that works in China. Offers service in Antarctica. BBB A+ rating.
{{Yes}}, plans available with unlimited calls to 20 countries, unlimited int'l texts, int'l roaming
China Telecom and parent company China Telecommunications Corporation are state-owned (by China). Dual-number activation: U.S. phone number and virtual Chinese local number.
{{maybe |Yes}}, but only until Fast Data allowance depleted
{{Yes}}, calling, texing, and int'l roaming for select countries
{{maybe |Yes}}, calls to int'l #s from U.S. included
AT&T, Sprint, and an unspecified third major network
{{maybe |Yes}}, though after 22 GB, service may be deprioritized during periods of network congestion
{{Yes}}, after 22 GB of fast data, during some periods of network congestion
{{maybe |Yes}}, with Unlimited plans, unlimited Calls to Canada and Mexico, and unlimited roaming in Mexico
Tablet plans available. Physical store in Cambridge, MA. Promotes tech literacy, puts on seminars at senior centers, etc.
{{No}}, plans capped at 20 GB max, and data service may be suspended if use exceeds 30 GB
{{No}}, though speeds may be throttled once use exceeds 20 GB in addition to overage charging
{{maybe |No}}, except for plans "specifically designated for tethering usage"; no information on site regarding such designation
Tablet plans available. Discounts offered to AARP members, including 5% off monthly service.
{{Yes}}, on Unlimited Data plan; 2G speeds: 64 kbps
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calls and roaming for select countries

Tablet plans available. Switched from Sprint to Verizon in August 2016. Sells itself as a strong supporter of liberal / progressive political issues such as "Saving Mother Earth" and funds Planned Parenthood, among others.

{{maybe |Yes}}, on Unlimited data plans, but data speeds throttled to 3 Mbps, video streaming throttled to 1.5 Mbps (SD quality); after 22 GB on Unlimited plan, or anytime on Unlimited Extra plan, "Cricket may temporarily slow data speeds during network congestion"
{{maybe |Yes}}, but on Unlimited data plans, after 10 GB, throttled to 2G speeds: 128 kbps

{{maybe |Yes}}, with appropriate plans: unlimited calling to landlines in 35 countries from U.S., unlimited texts to 37 countries from U.S., unlimited calling and texts to and from Canada, Mexico, and the U.S., roaming in Canada and Mexico
Tablet plans not offered? Owned by AT&T.
{{maybe |Yes}}, unlimited calls from U.S. to landlines in 80+ countries (and mobiles in some), unlimited texts to int'l #s from U.S.
{{maybe |Yes}}, calls to other countries from U.S.
No unlimited minutes or texts, either. Donates 100% of profits to environmental organizations.

Lifeline: AZ, AR, CA, CO, GA, HI, ID, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, MD, MI, MN, MS, MO, NE, NV, ND, OH, OK, OR, PA, PR, RI, SC, SD, TX, UT, WA, WV, WI, WY;
Personal
{{maybe |Yes}}, calls to int'l #s available through BOSS International Long Distance
{{maybe |Yes}}, but "By the end of 2019, 3G and older 4G devices will no longer work properly on Flash Wireless."
{{No}}, plans capped at 22 GB max with unlimited slow data, or (on Sprint only) 50 GB max without
{{maybe |Yes}}, but only on iPhone and select Android models, and on Sprint, only up to 10 GB
{{maybe |Yes}}, Calls but not Texts(?) to int'l #s in 130+ destinations; unlimited Calls but not Texts(?) to Canada, Mexico, and Puerto Rico; and int'l roaming in 200+ destinations
{{maybe |Yes}}, and texting, but only for Sprint?
{{maybe |Yes}}, and texting, but via FreedomPop app, not natively
Voice is VoIP by default; "Premium Voice" add-on enables cellular calling.
{{maybe |Yes}}, per-minute rates or unlimited calling and texting to 100+ countries, depending on countries and plans
{{maybe |Yes}}, but via FreeUP Talk app, not natively
Basic 250 Talk or Text plan available free with manual monthly renewal; upgraded plans available for additional charge, or free with designated usage of Rewards App.
{{maybe |Yes}}, unlimited calling to 100+ countries from U.S., unlimited int'l texts (on appropriate plans)
{{No}}, "Technically no. Tethering is against the Terms & Conditions of Good2Go."
{{maybe |Yes}}, unlimited Calls & Texts to 60 countries with International Plan, per-minute rate for other countries
{{maybe |Yes}}, but only designated models, and only "Designed for Fi" models have full functionality (e.g. non-Fi phones only use the T-Mobile network)
{{Yes}}, int'l calls, unlimited int'l texts, and roaming with data (6 GB fast, then unlimited slow, with Bill Protection), using Three network (UMTS-based)?
Switches automatically between the different listed host networks and Wi-Fi hotspots based on factors such as relative signal strength.
{{maybe |Yes}}, BYOD-only, but no NET10, SafeLink, Straight Talk, Telcel, Total Wireless, or TracFone phones allowed
{{maybe |Yes}}, on unlimited data plan, but at 4G speeds only with Facebook, and 3G speeds for all else; phone hotspot limited to 10 GB Fast Data
{{maybe |Yes}}, but limited to 10 GB Fast Data on unlimited data plan (up to 20 GB shared Fast Data on 20 GB plan)
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling to 69 destinations; roaming in Mexico, Dominican Republic, and many Latin American countries
Owned by TracFone Wireless. Acquired from T-Mobile.
{{Yes}}, int'l calling, texting, and roaming in select destinations
"Senior Cell Phones, Medical Alert Systems & Safety for Seniors". Owned by Best Buy.
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calls to 10 unique int'l landline #s per month in landlines in 50+ countries and to mobile phones in select countries on non-Pay-As-You-Go plans, int'l texting
{{maybe |Yes}}, on Unlimited data plan, but "speeds may be lowered during periods of high congestion"
{{maybe |Yes}}, unlimited int'l calling and texting from U.S.

"A Nationwide prepaid carrier for any Sprint device and for blacklisted iPhones from Verizon, T-Mobile, and At&t [sic]". FAQ page is empty. Targets youth market, with plans called "Cool", "Wow", "No Way", and "Holy Cow".
{{anchor |Internet on the Go}}Internet on the Go
"your choice of the five largest U.S. wireless networks, as well as one in Canada"
{{No}}, specialty 3-button i Luv Wireless KC2 only?
GPS tracker phone for communication between kids and their parents.
Phones available for sale online and in Kroger-owned stores such as Ralphs.
{{maybe |Yes}}, but prohibited are video streaming above SD (must be manually limited), "large" downloads, hosting servers, etc.
Founded to provide high-speed Internet service to rural customers.
Few service details available on company website. No online orders "at this time" – must call their toll-free number. "Shop" link points to nonexistent domain name.

{{maybe |Yes}}, on the top High Data Plan, but "After Use of 50GB of 4G LTE, data speeds may be reduced for the remainder of the plan period", and tethering / phone hotspot is not permitted on this (or any?) plan
{{Yes}}, unlimited talk & text to 75+ countries, int'l roaming

Lycamobile has been involved in legal and financial controversies in France, Ireland, and the U.K. They are a significant donor to the British Conservative Party. See {{section link |Lycamobile |Controversies}} for details and citations.
{{Yes}}, 3G speeds: up to 512 kbps on Ultimate Plan
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling, and int'l roaming in countries with CDMA networks(?)
Talk & Text (not Data) roams onto Verizon Network for no additional charge.

{{maybe |Yes}}, on Unlimited High-Speed plans, but "If congested, the fraction of customers using >35GB∕month may notice reduced speeds and Metro customers may notice reduced speeds vs. T-mobile due to prioritization. Video streams at 480p. Unlimited on handset and on network only."
{{maybe |Yes}}, unlimited calls and texts to select countries, and roaming in Canada and Mexico
Formerly MetroPCS; owned by T-Mobile US.
{{maybe |Yes}}, though "The data you use just pulls from your monthly 4G LTE amount", which may indicate phone hotspot cannot use unlimited slow data
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l long distance calling via PLD, and int'l roaming

Formerly Mint SIM; subsidiary of Ultra Mobile. Targets youth market with website content like "C’mon, aren’t you dying to use the phone plan with a cute little fox on everything?" and "Staying connected while exploring the world just got super F*!ing easy! (We said “Foxing.”)". campusSIMS partners with Mint to serve the market of international students in the U.S.
{{maybe |Yes}}, but only in Japan with Japan SIMs; Europe SIM capped at 7 GB max
{{maybe |Yes}}, with USA Visitor SIM only: 2G speeds (128 kbps) after 2 GB of 4G data
{{maybe |Yes}}, "but there is no guarantee that it will work"
{{Yes}}, int'l calling, texts, and roaming with appropriate SIMs

Bypasses the usual stringent requirements for obtaining a Japanese SIM. Donates the majority of its profits to self-founded charity ("Krizevac transforms communities. This starts with placing a cross on a mountain in an area of great need. This symbolizes the values of public service & personal sacrifice underpinning the Krizevac Charity."). "Mobal is one of the world's longest running cell phone providers and was founded in 1989".
AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile, {{citation needed span |[[U.S. Cellular]] (only on PAY-AS-YOU-GO minute plans), |date=July 2019}} Verizon
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling, and unlimited int'l texting on a few phone models
{{maybe |Yes}}, unlimited int'l talk & text in U.S., Canada, and Puerto Rico
Sprint (main page claims "All 4 US Carriers in one place", but only Sprint shown as option on Coverage page)
{{As of |2019|7}}, the website's SSL certificate expired 2019-05-21. Linked-to FAQ page does not exist.
No Terms & Conditions page ("Updating policy. Will be posted soon.").

{{maybe |Yes}}, on Fully Unlimited 4G LTE data plan, but "Video typically streams at DVD quality", and "At 60 GB, we reserve the right to review your account for usage in violation of Page Plus's terms and conditions."
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling from U.S., including unlimited calls to Canada and Mexico
Tablet plans available. Takes a political stance with "Mobilizing Conservatives" tagline and "fight the liberal agenda through your phone", etc.
AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile ("Coming Soon" {{as of |2019 |8 |lc=y}}), Verizon
{{maybe |[[AT&T Mobility|AT&T]]: Yes}} / Sprint: No, plans capped at 12 GB max / T-Mobile: Unannounced / Verizon: No, plans capped at 12 GB max
{{maybe |[[AT&T Mobility|AT&T]]: No?}} / Sprint: Yes, 2G speeds / T-Mobile: Unannounced / Verizon: Yes
{{maybe |[[AT&T Mobility|AT&T]]: Yes}} / Sprint: No / T-Mobile: No / Verizon: No / International: Yes, assuming active data plan in participating country
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l SIMs available, but Calls and Texts to int'l #s with U.S. SIMs only available on Verizon network
{{Yes}}, int'l calling, unlimited int'l texting, voice + data roaming in 200+ countries

{{maybe |Yes}}, BYOD-only, but on Verizon network, "CDMA (3G)-only devices, including 3G basic phones and 3G smartphones / 4G LTE smartphones that do not support HD Voice / Apple® iPhone® 5s or prior including the Apple® iPhone® 5c" can no longer be activated

{{maybe |Yes}}, but "we have the right, at our discretion, to suspend or terminate your account for any excessive or abusive use"; on T-Mobile and Verizon, "Netflix and other Movie Streaming are prohibited"
Donates a share of profits to the Pancreatic Cancer Action Network.
{{Yes}}, with deprioritization and/or throttling to 2G speeds (128 kbps)
{{maybe |Yes}}, coverage in Canda and Mexico with 5 GB of LTE data, though "service may be suspended, terminated, or restricted for...significant roaming"

{{maybe |Yes}}, BYOD-only, but on Verizon network, "CDMA (3G)-only devices, including 3G basic phones and 3G smartphones / 4G LTE smartphones that do not support HD Voice / Apple® iPhone® 5s or prior including the Apple® iPhone® 5c" can no longer be activated
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling from U.S., Puerto Rico, and U.S. Virgin Islands
Unlimited talk and text plans available.
{{No}}, plans capped at 10 GB max for Sprint and Verizon, 20 GB max for AT&T and T-Mobile
{{maybe |[[AT&T Mobility|AT&T]]: Android only}} / Sprint: Android & iOS / T-Mobile: Android & iOS / Verizon: iOS only
{{Yes}}, calling, unlimited texting, and voice(?) + data roaming
{{maybe |Yes}}, but only for Android devices on the T-Mobile network
{{maybe |Yes}}, but only Android, and only devices Republic sells or has sold
{{No}}, plans capped at 4 GB max, or 5 GB for tablets or hotspot devices
{{maybe |Yes}}, 2G speeds, but not for tablets or hotspot devices
{{maybe |Yes}}, but "Users who use more than 22GB may see slowdowns … during times of extreme network congestion", and prohibited uses include "Large downloads", "Streaming video in HD", etc.
AT&T (?), Sprint (?), T-Mobile (CA), U.S. Cellular (?), Verizon (?)
{{No}}, only one provider-supplied device supported, the Coolpad Arise (Android 4.4)
{{No}} (except calls and texts to U.S. numbers from foreign Wi-Fi networks)
Uses Wi-Fi instead of cellular network, whenever available, for voice, texts, and data.
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling & texting from U.S., including 30+ countries for free
"With business locations in both the US and China, Seawolf focuses on the world's largest two communication markets, offering a wide range of IT/Communication solutions and services".

{{No}}, "International use is strictly prohibited on Selectel’s service. Dialing and/or receiving international calls and/or texts may result in permanent suspension due to violation of terms of use. In the event your service is supended for violation of terms of use a refund for purchased plans will not be issued."
Has corporate stores and authorized retailers throughout most of the U.S.

{{maybe |Yes}}, on Truly Unlimited plans, but "Video Streams at up to 480p", "If congested, customers may notice reduced speeds vs. T-Mobile customers that may be further reduced for small number of customers who use >40GB." [sic], and phone hotspot limited to 10 GB
{{Yes}}, 2G speeds after up to 15 GB (or 10 GB starting October 2019) 4G LTE data
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling, unlimited texting, and roaming in Mexico and several Central and South American countries
{{No}}, plans capped at 20 GB max (and only SD video streaming is supported)
{{maybe |Yes}}, but after 5 GB of fast data usage, speeds are reduced to 600 kbps
{{Yes}}, int'l calling, unlimited texting, and roaming
Tablet plans available. Spectrum Mobile is available to Spectrum Internet subscribers only. Owned by Charter Communications.
{{No}}, but "working hard on getting this on board"
{{Yes}}, on Ultimate Unlimited plan, but "At 60 GB, we reserve the right to review your account for usage in violation of Straight Talk’s terms and conditions."
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calls from U.S. to 1,000+ landline destinations, and to mobile phones in Canada, China, India, and Mexico
Tablet plans available. Owned by TracFone Wireless. Rooted or jailbroken devices not allowed.
{{No}}, plan capped at 20 GB of 8 Mbps 4G LTE data (or up to 120 Mbps with Data Boost add-on)
{{Yes}}, int'l calling, text, and voice + data roaming (with Global Pass add-on)

{{maybe |Yes}}, unlimited calls from U.S. or Puerto Rico to up to 15 int'l landlines; unlimited calls to up to 15 mobile #s in Canada, China, India, and Mexico; int'l texting to Mexico only; and voice + data roaming in Mexico
{{maybe |Yes}}, 2G speeds, but not for phone hotspot
{{maybe |Yes}}, but no Unlimited: disabled after 4G data allotment is depleted
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calls and texts from U.S.
Lifeline: CO, GA, HI, IN, IA, KS, KY, MD, MI, MN, MO, NE, NV, ND, OH, RI, SC, UT, WV, WI, WY
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling from U.S. and Canada, unlimited texting to 100+ countries
{{maybe |Yes}}, but via TextNow app, not natively?
No unlimited minutes or texts, either. Sprint-network Talk & Text service roams to Verizon. Owned by Canada's Tucows Inc.
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling from U.S. with Global ILD add-on
AT&T, T-Mobile, {{citation needed span |[[U.S. Cellular]] ([[feature phone]]s only), |date=July 2019}} Verizon
TracFone Wireless is a subsidiary of América Móvil.

Lifeline: AR, CA, CO, GA, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, MD, MI, MN, MO, NV, OH, OK, PA, SC, TX, WV, WI;
Personal
{{No}}?, but such service is offered through their Internet on the Go brand
{{No}}, plans capped at 2 GB for non-CA Lifeline, 3 GB for CA Lifeline, or 4 GB max for non-Lifeline
No FAQ section. Previously also offered Sprint service. Formerly Telscape Communications.
{{maybe |Yes}}, calls to ~20 countries and texts to ~180 countries from U.S. for no additional charge
{{maybe |Yes}}, but only using 3rd-party apps, not natively
Talk & Text (not Data) roams onto Verizon Network for no additional charge.

{{maybe |Yes}}, though "Full speeds available up to monthly allotment, including tethering, then slowed up to 2G speeds for remainder of service period" may indicate that phone hotspot ceases functioning after fast data is depleted
{{maybe |Yes}}, unlimited calling to 80+ destinations, int'l texting, int'l roaming
{{maybe |Yes}}, but via Unreal Mobile app, not natively
On AT&T network, all calling is via VoIP. Owned by FreedomPop.
{{maybe |Yes}}, on Unlimited data plan, but not for phone hotspot
{{maybe |Yes}}, 2G speeds, but not for phone hotspot
{{maybe |Yes}}, but usage capped at 500 MB/day or 2 GB/month max
{{maybe |Yes}}, int'l calling and texting from U.S., Puerto Rico, and U.S. Virgin Islands
Originally a joint venture between Sprint Corporation and Virgin Group; owned solely by Sprint since 2009.
{{maybe |Yes}}, but only iPhone 6 and up, and a few phones from Google, Motorola, Samsung, and ZTE

{{anchor |Visible}}{{maybe |Yes}}. No usage-based throttling, but on-phone & tethering speeds normally capped at 5 Mbps. {{As of |2019|6}}, for a limited time, new & existing customers receive uncapped on-phone speeds for lifetime of their accounts; tethering speeds remain capped. Typical "download speeds of 5-12 Mbps and upload speeds of 2-5 Mbps." "However, when the network gets congested, your data could slow up for a bit. But this is common for any person on any carrier."
{{maybe |Yes}}, during Early Access period; speeds capped at 5 Mbps; only one device may connect to the mobile hotspot at a time

Owned by Verizon. No toll-free customer service #; service provided via in-app chat, text, Facebook, or Twitter; callbacks by request. Some report volatile speeds (e.g. jumping between 29 & 10 Mbps) due to common carrier practice of prioritizing MVNO customer traffic below direct customer traffic. In very congested areas such as Washington D.C., some have seen average speeds below 0.2 Mbps, suggesting prioritization even below other Verizon MVNOs. Visible Connect assists nonprofit technology startups.
{{maybe |Yes}}, on Truly Unlimited plan, but tethering limited to 5 GB on this plan; "Video typically streams at DVD quality"
{{Yes}}, 2G speeds, after up to 14 GB 4G LTE data
{{maybe |Yes}}, but unclear if tethering continues to function after 4G data is depleted
{{maybe |Yes}}, with Extras Pack: int'l calling, and roaming in Canada, the Dominican Republic, and Mexico
Family plans with discounts for up to 4 additonal lines. Owned by TracFone Wireless. Acquired from T-Mobile.
{{maybe |Yes}}, 2G speeds, but on Sprint network only
{{Yes}}, int'l calling, texting, and voice + data roaming
{{maybe |Yes}}, but Apple and certain Android models only
Tablet plans available. Owned by Comcast Corporation. Available to Xfinity cable Internet customers only.
{{maybe |Yes}}, but tethering not included except on Business plan; video streaming limited to 480p (~5 Mbps)
{{maybe |Yes}}, unlimited int'l texting; free roaming in Mexico on Business plan
Tablet plans available. "SIM cards for international travelers in the USA".
